info.title: NGINX One Console Spec
info.description: The API Reference documentation for NGINX One Console

namespace.description: The application namespace used to organize and scope API resources.

tenant_cname.description: The specific DNS name used to access your tenant.

tags.name: Data Plane Key
tags.description:
The `DataPlaneKey` object represents a secure token required to establish a connection between your NGINX instances and NGINX One. 
As a fundamental security measure, the data plane key ensures that only trusted NGINX instances can register and communicate with NGINX One. 

Data plane keys expire after one year. This is the default setting if you don't specify an expiration time when you create a key. 
If necessary, you can update the data plane key later to extend its expiration.

Revoking a data plane key will disconnect the associated NGINX instances from NGINX One.

**IMPORTANT** Data plane keys are not saved and are displayed only once when you generate them. You should save this key in a secure location for future reference.

tags.name: Instances
tags.description:
The `Instance` object represents an active NGINX installation. 
You can access detailed information about each NGINX instance, including its configuration analysis, security advisories, and operational status.

tags.name: Config Sync Groups
tags.description:
The `ConfigSyncGroups` object represents a NGINX config sync group where `Instances` are grouped to have same configuration. 
You can access detailed information about each NGINX config sync group, including its configuration analysis and operational status.

tags.name: Certificates
tags.description:
The `Certificates` object in the NGINX One console represents an SSL certificate, covering both managed and unmanaged types. 
You can view essential details like issuer, expiration status, and the instances or config sync groups where each certificate is deployed.

tags.name: CVEs
tags.description: The `CVEs` object represents the security advisories published for all the F5 products supported by NGINX One.

tags.name: Events
tags.description: Get a list of system events in the NGINX One console.

tags.name: Staged Configs
tags.description: The `StagedConfigs` object represents a NGINX staged config which users can save to publish at a later time.

tags.name: Control Planes
tags.description:
The `Control Planes` object represents an external control plane such as NGINX Ingress Controller.
From this endpoint, you can get detailed information about each control plane, including its NGINX instances, configurations, security advisories, and operational status.

tags.name: Settings
tags.description:
Configuration option for different aspect of NGINX One service.
You can set NGINX Instance cleanup preferences.

tags.name: NGINX App Protect
tags.description: Manage and publish security policies on your NGINX data plane instances.

get.summary: List all data plane keys
get.description:
Returns a list of data plane keys for your tenant namespace. 
This list provides important information such as each key's name, when it was created, and when it will expire.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the list of data plane keys.

500.description: An unexpected error occurred on the server. Please try the request again later.

patch.summary: Bulk operation on multiple data plane keys
patch.description: Performs bulk operation on one or more data plane keys, only delete is supported.

200.description: Batch request completed.

500.description: An unexpected error occurred on the server. Please try the request again later.

post.description:
Creates a unique data plane key that you can use to register NGINX instances with NGINX One.

**IMPORTANT**: Save the data plane key somewhere secure for reference. The key is displayed only once and cannot be retrieved again.

200.description: Successfully created the data plane key.

400.description: Request cannot be processed due to invalid input or parameters. Verify the request format and provided data.

500.description: An unexpected error occurred on the server. Please try the request again later.

204.description: Successfully deleted the data plane key.

404.description: The data plane key with the specified object_id was not found. Check that the object_id provided is correct and corresponds to an existing resource.

409.description: Cannot delete an active data plane key. Revoke the key first, then try deleting it again.

500.description: An unexpected error occurred on the server. Please try the request again later.

get.summary: Retrieve a data plane key
get.description: Retrieves the details for an existing data plane key.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the details of the data plane key.

500.description: An unexpected error occurred on the server. Please try the request again later.

patch.description:
Updates an existing data plane key. 

You can update the data plane key's name or extend its expiration date. It's not possible to update the expiration date for a data plane key that has expired.

200.description: Successfully updated the data plane key.

400.description: Request cannot be processed due to invalid input or parameters. Verify the request format and provided data.

404.description: The data plane key with the specified object_id was not found. Check that the object_id provided is correct and corresponds to an existing resource.

500.description: An unexpected error occurred on the server. Please try the request again later.

put.description:
Revoke an existing data plane key.

**IMPORTANT**: When you revoke a data plane key, all NGINX instances registered with this key will be disconnected from NGINX One.

404.description: The data plane key with the specified object_id was not found. Check that the object_id provided is correct and corresponds to an existing resource.

500.description: An unexpected error occurred on the server. Please try the request again later.

get.summary: List all SSL certificates
get.description: Returns a paginated list showing metadata for every SSL certificate.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the list of SSL certificates.

500.description: An unexpected error occurred on the server. Please try the request again later.

post.description:
Creates a new SSL certificate with an optional name. 
You must supply the certificate's content in base64-encoded PEM format.
Any warnings will be displayed only upon creation of the certificate object, and
is not retrievable after it is created.

200.description: Successfully created the SSL certificate.

400.description: Request cannot be processed due to invalid input or parameters. Verify the request format and provided data.

500.description: An unexpected error occurred on the server. Please try the request again later.

delete.description:
* Deletes a managed SSL certificate from the NGINX One console. This operation is disabled for unmanaged certificates, as they get cleaned up automatically when they are not used in any NGINX configuration. 
* An optional flag `deleteFromDataPlanes` when set to true, can be used to remove the certificate from data plane instances to where it was deployed.
  * Deleting from data planes triggers publications on either instances or Config Sync Groups. After the managed cert object is deleted from NGINX One Console, a `PublicationBulkResponse` is returned along with status code 202, indicating whether an error occurred while issuing a publication to a data plane target.
  * If this cert is not associated with any data plane, status code 204 is returned when `deleteFromDataPlanes` set to true.

202.description: Successfully deleted the SSL certificate. Handling deletion of certificate from data planes in the background.

400.description: Request cannot be processed due to invalid input or parameters. Verify the request format and provided data.

404.description: The SSL certificate with the specified object_id was not found. Check that the object_id provided is correct and corresponds to an existing resource.

500.description: An unexpected error occurred on the server. Please try the request again later.

get.summary: Retrieve an SSL certificate
get.description:
Retrieves the details for an SSL certificate, including:
* Object ID that uniquely identifies this certificate object
* SSL certificate type (managed or unmanaged by NGINX One Console)
* Certificate type (whether it is a CA bundle or a certificate-key pair)
* Subject name of the leaf certificate, or the soonest-expiring CA in a bundle
  * This subject name will be the DNS name in the SAN extension of the certificate. If not present, it will be the certificate's common name
* Status of the certificate (valid, expiring, expired)
* Validity period, if applicable to multiple certificates
* Metadata for each public certificate if multiples are provided
* Private key metadata, if available

200.description: Successfully retrieved the details of the SSL certificate.

404.description: The SSL certificate with the specified object_id was not found. Check that the object_id provided is correct and corresponds to an existing resource.

500.description: An unexpected error occurred on the server. Please try the request again later.

patch.description:
Updates public certificates, private keys, or both. 
This endpoint can also be used to update a Certificate Authority (CA) bundle.

200.description: Successfully updated the specified SSL certificate.

400.description: Request cannot be processed due to invalid input or parameters. Verify the request format and provided data.

404.description: The SSL certificate with the specified object_id was not found. Check that the object_id provided is correct and corresponds to an existing resource.

500.description: An unexpected error occurred on the server. Please try the request again later.

get.summary: List SSL certificate deployments
get.description: Returns a paginated list showing all the deployments for a SSL certificate and assigned file path(s).

200.description: Successfully retrieved the list of SSL certificate deployments.

404.description: The SSL certificate with the specified object_id was not found. Check that the object_id provided is correct and corresponds to an existing resource.

500.description: An unexpected error occurred on the server. Please try the request again later.

post.summary: Parse and validate an SSL certificate
post.description:
Parses and validates an SSL certificate. 
It checks the provided PEM files and verifies that the public certificates follow the correct X.509 format. 
If the certificate cannot be parsed, an error will be returned. 
Otherwise, as long as the certificate is parsable, a `200 OK` status will be returned even if there are issues 
such as mismatched private keys or expired certificates. Details of any issues found will be shown in the "warnings" field of the response.

200.description: Successfully parsed and validated the SSL certificate.

400.description: Request cannot be processed due to invalid input or parameters. Verify the request format and provided data.

500.description: An unexpected error occurred on the server. Please try the request again later.

patch.summary: Apply partial updates to config sync group's configuration
patch.description:
Applies the specified partial updates to an existing NGINX configuration. Details:
  * This endpoint accepts additive updates to `NginxConfig`. 
  * To delete files, omit the `file.contents` field. 
  * This method compares the provided config_version with the current NGINX config sync group configuration to detect conflicts, which may arise if the config_version does not match due to an out-of-band update.

200.description: Successfully stored the configuration of the NGINX config sync group

202.description: The request to publish the configuration has been accepted and is being processed. To check the publication status, make a GET request to /config-sync-groups/{configSyncGroupObjectID}/publications.

400.description: Request cannot be processed due to invalid input or parameters. Verify the request format and provided data.

404.description: The NGINX config sync group with the specified object_id was not found. Check that the object_id provided is correct and corresponds to an existing resource.

500.description: An unexpected error occurred on the server. Please try the request again later.

put.summary: Publish a configuration to NGINX config sync group
put.description:
Publishes a new or updated NGINX configuration to the specified config sync group. 
If no existing configuration is found, a new one is created; otherwise, the current configuration is overwritten.

200.description: Successfully stored the configuration of the NGINX config sync group.

202.description: The request to publish the configuration has been accepted and is being processed. To check the publication status, make a GET request to /config-sync-groups/{configSyncGroupObjectID}/publications.

400.description: Request cannot be processed due to invalid input or parameters. Verify the request format and provided data.

404.description: The NGINX config sync group with the specified object_id was not found. Check that the object_id provided is correct and corresponds to an existing resource.

500.description: An unexpected error occurred on the server. Please try the request again later.

get.summary: Retrieve an analysis report for the configuration of an NGINX config sync group
get.description:
Analyzes the configuration of an NGINX config sync group and returns a detailed report.
The report includes insights, identified issues, and recommendations for optimizing and troubleshooting.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the NGINX configuration analysis for the specified config sync group.

204.description: The requested config sync group exists, but analysis of the NGINX configuration is not yet completed. Please retry the request at a later time to retrieve the report.

404.description: The NGINX config sync group with the specified object_id was not found. Check that the object_id provided is correct and corresponds to an existing resource.

500.description: An unexpected error occurred on the server. Please try the request again later.

patch.summary: Generate an analysis report for the configuration of the modified NGINX config sync group
patch.description:
Analyzes the provided partial updates merging with an existing configuration of an NGINX config sync group. Generates a report detailing potential issues along with optimization suggestions. 
This analysis accounts for additive updates made to NGINX configuration. To delete files, omit the `file.contents` field. 
This method compares the provided `config_version` with the current NGINX config sync group's configuration to detect conflicts, which may arise if the `config_version` does not match due to an out-of-band update. 
Note that this operation is for analysis purposes only and does not apply any changes to the configuration. 
The report is not stored and is provided only in the API response.
To publish the configuration, use the `PATCH /config-sync-groups/{configSyncGroupObjectID}/config` endpoint.

200.description: Successfully analyzed the provided NGINX configuration

400.description: Request cannot be processed due to invalid input or parameters. Verify the request format and provided data.

404.description: The NGINX config sync group with the specified object_id was not found. Check that the object_id provided is correct and corresponds to an existing resource.

500.description: An unexpected error occurred on the server. Please try the request again later.

put.summary: Generate an analysis report for the configuration of the NGINX config sync group
put.description: Returns an analysis report for the configuration of the NGINX config sync group. This report includes insights, identified issues, and recommendations for optimizing and troubleshooting. Note that this operation is for analysis purposes only and does not apply any changes to the configuration. The report is not stored and is provided only in the API response. To publish the configuration, use the `PUT /config-sync-groups/{configSyncGroupObjectID}/config` endpoint.

200.description: Successfully analyzed the provided NGINX configuration.

400.description: Request cannot be processed due to invalid input or parameters. Verify the request format and provided data.

404.description: The NGINX config sync group with the specified object_id was not found. Check that the object_id provided is correct and corresponds to an existing resource.

patch.summary: Apply partial updates to an instance's configuration
patch.description:
Applies the specified partial updates to an existing NGINX configuration. 
This endpoint accepts additive updates to `NginxConfig`. 
To delete files, omit the `file.contents` field. 
This method compares the provided config_version with the current NGINX instance configuration to detect conflicts, which may arise if the config_version does not match due to an out-of-band update. 
Before publishing, use the `PATCH /instances/{instanceObjectID}/config-report` endpoint to generate an analysis report for the modified configuration.

202.description: The request to publish the configuration has been accepted and is being processed. To check the publication status, make a GET request to /instances/{instanceObjectID}/publications.

400.description: Request cannot be processed due to invalid input or parameters. Verify the request format and provided data.

put.summary: Publish a configuration to an instance
put.description:
Publishes a new or updated NGINX configuration to the specified instance.
In the specified `configs`, empty files are not allowed in the directory.
If no existing configuration is found, a new one is created; otherwise, the current configuration is overwritten. 
Before publishing, use the `PUT /instances/{instanceObjectID}/config-report` endpoint to generate an analysis report for the provided configuration.
You can specify `payloads` in the request to deploy managed certificates and keys to the dataplane. Include file paths
for each payload component.

202.description: The request to publish the configuration has been accepted and is being processed. To check the publication status, make a GET request to /instances/{instanceObjectID}/publications.

400.description: Request cannot be processed due to invalid input or parameters. Verify the request format and provided data.

404.description: The NGINX instance with the specified object_id was not found. Check that the object_id provided is correct and corresponds to an existing resource.

500.description: An unexpected error occurred on the server. Please try the request again later.

204.description: The requested instance exists, but analysis of the NGINX configuration is not yet completed. Please retry the request at a later time to retrieve the report.

patch.summary: Generate an analysis report for the provided modified configuration
patch.description:
Analyzes the provided partial updates to an existing NGINX configuration and generates a report detailing potential issues along with optimization suggestions. 
This analysis accounts for additive updates made to `NginxConfig`. To delete files, omit the `file.contents` field. 
This method compares the provided `config_version` with the current NGINX instance configuration to detect conflicts, which may arise if the `config_version` does not match due to an out-of-band update. 
Note that this operation is for analysis purposes only and does not apply any changes to the configuration. 
The report is not stored and is provided only in the API response.
To publish the configuration, use the `PATCH /instances/{instanceObjectID}/config` endpoint.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the specific Publication for the specified NGINX instance.

404.description: The NGINX instance or Publication with the specified object_id was not found. Check that the object_id provided is correct and corresponds to an existing resource.

500.description: An unexpected error occurred on the server. Please try the request again later.

  * Version of the NGINX Agent

patch.summary: Apply partial updates to staged config
patch.description:
Applies the specified partial updates to an existing NGINX staged config Details:
  * This endpoint accepts additive updates to `NginxConfig`. Base `nginx.conf` file must always be provided along with additives.
  * To delete files, omit the `file.contents` field.
  * `config_version` is used to ensure the requested patch is applied against the same version.

200.description: Successfully stored the NGINX staged configuration.

400.description: Request cannot be processed due to invalid input or parameters. Verify the request format and provided data.

404.description: The NGINX staged config with the specified object_id was not found. Check that the object_id provided is correct and corresponds to an existing resource.

409.description: NGINX config version mismatch. Provided config_version does not match recent config_version for the NGINX staged config, possible conflict.

500.description: An unexpected error occurred on the server. Please try the request again later.

put.description: Completely replaces existing staged config with payload of new request.

200.description: Successfully updated the NGINX configuration.

400.description: Request cannot be processed due to invalid input or parameters. Verify the request format and provided data.

404.description: The NGINX staged config with the specified object_id was not found. Check that the object_id provided is correct and corresponds to an existing resource.

500.description: An unexpected error occurred on the server. Please try the request again later.

get.summary: Retrieve an analysis report for the NGINX staged config
get.description:
Analyzes the NGINX staged config and returns a detailed report.
The report includes insights, identified issues, and recommendations for optimizing and troubleshooting.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the NGINX configuration analysis for the specified staged config.

204.description: The requested staged config exists, but analysis of the NGINX configuration is not yet completed. Please retry the request at a later time to retrieve the report.

404.description: The NGINX staged config with the specified object_id was not found. Check that the object_id provided is correct and corresponds to an existing resource.

500.description: An unexpected error occurred on the server. Please try the request again later.

patch.summary: Generate an analysis report for the modified NGINX staged config
patch.description:
Analyzes the provided partial updates merging with an existing configuration of an NGINX config sync group. Generates a report detailing potential issues along with optimization suggestions. 
This analysis accounts for additive updates made to NGINX configuration. To delete files, omit the `file.contents` field. 
Note that this operation is for analysis purposes only and does not apply any changes to the configuration. 
The report is not stored and is provided only in the API response.
To publish the configuration, use the `PATCH /staged-configs/{stagedConfigObjectID}/config` endpoint.

200.description: Successfully analyzed the provided NGINX configuration

400.description: Request cannot be processed due to invalid input or parameters. Verify the request format and provided data.

404.description: The NGINX staged config with the specified object_id was not found. Check that the object_id provided is correct and corresponds to an existing resource.

500.description: An unexpected error occurred on the server. Please try the request again later.

post.summary: Retrieve system metrics for instances with series limit
post.description:
Returns (up to 10,000) system metrics for NGINX instances with series limit based on query parameters.

You can filter metrics by name and timestamp, aggregate metrics over a configurable period of time, and group metrics by dimension.

200.description: Successfully retrieved system metrics.

Paginated.name: paginated
Paginated.description:
A boolean indicating if the results should be presented as a paginated list. Defaults to `true`. 
When set to `false` a maximum of 3000 results are returned.

Limit.name: limit
Limit.description:
An integer that specifies the maximum number of items to be returned. 
Setting this to `0` will result in no items being returned, but a total count will still be provided. 
This parameter is not applicable if `paginated` is `false`.

Offset.name: offset
Offset.description:
An integer that specifies the starting position of the results, starting at `1`.
This parameter is not applicable if `paginated` is `false`.

FilterFieldDataPlaneKeys.name: filter_fields
FilterFieldDataPlaneKeys.description:
Filter options for data plane keys; used in conjunction with other filter parameters having the same array length.

When filtering on `status`, only the following `filter_values` are supported:
  * revoked
  * expired
  * valid

FilterOperands.name: filter_ops
FilterOperands.description:
An array of strings defining the operands for filtering, to be used in conjunction with `filter_fields` and `filter_values`. 
All filter parameters must have matching array lengths. Currently, the only supported operand is `"IN"`.

FilterValues.name: filter_values
FilterValues.description:
An array of strings containing the keywords for filtering. 
Multiple keywords can be chained using the `|` character. 
Ensure this parameter's array length matches those of `filter_fields` and `filter_ops` for effective filtering.
The total length of the filter string should not exceed 1024 characters.

DataPlaneKeyParamObjectID.description: A globally unique identifier for the data plane key.

FilterNameDataPlaneKeys.description:
Keywords for data plane key filters.
When filtering on `status`, only the following `filter_values` are supported:
  * revoked
  * valid

PaginationResponse.description: Outlines pagination details for list responses, including total results, start index, and items per page.

total.description: The absolute total number of the resource in the NGINX One Console, ignoring any filter(s).

count.description:
The total number of results generated by the list or query operation, accounting for any filter(s).
This number can be greater than the number of returned resources when pagination is in effect and a page size limit (or maximum allowed) is reached.

start_index.description: The first result's starting position in the list. This is disregarded when `paginated=false`.

items_per_page.description: The number of items to display per page. This is disregarded when `paginated=false`.

DataPlaneKeyObjectID.description: A globally unique identifier for the data plane key.

DataPlaneKey.description: Represents a data plane key with details such as object_id, name, and timestamps.

name.description: The name given to the data plane key.

revoked.description: Indicates whether the data plane key has been revoked or not.

revoked_at.description: The date and time when the data plane key was revoked.

expires_at.description: The date and time when the data plane key expires.

created_at.description: The date and time when the data plane key was created.

modified_at.description: The date and time when the data plane key was last modified.

instances_count.description: The number of registered instances using this data plane key. If field not populated, user should see the key has `unknown` key count

control_planes_count.description: The number of observed control planes using this data plane key.

Error.description: This object contains details about the errors that are returned when API requests fail.

message.description: The error message describing the problem.

request_id.description: The unique identifier of the API request that failed.

timestamp.description: The date and time (in UTC) when the error happened.

detail.description: Additional information about the error, if available.

DataPlaneKeyCreateRequest.description: Request structure for creating a new data plane key.

name.description: Give the data plane key a name so you can tell it apart from others.

expires_at.description:
Set an expiration date and time for the data plane key in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ. 
If an expiration date isn't specified, the key will expire one year after it's created. 

You can use the _Update a data plane key_ endpoint to extend the expiration date.
It's not possible to update the expiration date once the data plane key has expired.

DataPlaneKeyResponse.description: Response structure containing details of the created or retrieved data plane key.

name.description: The name to be give to the new data plane key.

key.description: The data plane key value. Save this key somewhere secure as it isn't saved and is shown only once.

expires_at.description: The date and time when the data plane key will expire.

BulkRequestAction.description:
Bulk action to perform:
  * `create` creates a new object given all required elements.
  * `modify` updates one or more elements of an existing object.
  * `delete` removes the existing object.

DataPlaneKeyBulkRequestData.description: Part of bulk operation on a data plane key, only `delete` is supported.

name.description: this is the user facing name of the object.

outcome.description:
This is the outcome that corresponds to the action.
* deleted - the object deletion was processed, and the object was deleted.
* accepted - the request was accepted, and will be processed.
* failed - the request failed, see failure_reason for more details.
* invalid - the request was invalid, see failure_reason for more details.

failure_reason.description: this is the failure reason populated when outcome is 'failed' or 'invalid'.

DataPlaneKeyBulkResponse.description: The data plane key bulk outcome.

DataPlaneKeyUpdateRequest.description: Request structure for updating an existing data plane key.

name.description: Give the data plane key a new name so you can tell it apart from others.

expires_at.description:
Adjust the expiration date and time for the data plane key in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ. 

It's not possible to update the expiration date once the data plane key has expired.

FilterNameCertificates.description:
Keywords for certificates filters.
When filtering on `management`, only the following `filter_values` are supported:
  * managed
  * unmanaged
When filtering on `type`, only the following `filter_values` are supported:
  * cert_key
  * ca_bundle
  * unknown
When filtering on `status`, only the following `filter_values` are supported:
  * valid
  * expiring
  * expired
  * not_ready

CertificateObjectID.description: A globally unique identifier for the certificates.

CertificateManagement.description:
Management type:
  * `managed` - Certificate managed by NGINX One Console.
  * `unmanaged` - Certificate that only exists on a data plane instance, detected from its NGINX configuration.

CertificateType.description:
Certificate type:
  * `ca_bundle` - This certificate object is a CA bundle.
  * `cert_key` - This certificate object is consisted of public certificates and key.
  * `unmanaged` - This certificate is not managed by NGINX One console and its type is unmanaged.

name.description: Name of the certificate, optionally specified upon creation

certs_count.description: The number of public certificates under this certificate object.

CertificateStatus.description:
Status of the certificate:
  * `valid` - The certificate is currently valid and operational.
  * `expiring` -  The certificate will expire within the next 30 days. Consider renewing it to maintain uninterrupted service.
  * `expired` - The certificate is no longer valid. Immediate renewal is recommended to ensure secure connections.
  * `not_ready` - The certificate is not ready to be used, based on the start date of its validity period.

CertificateDisplayMetadata.description: This represents the essential metadata of a public certificate.

subject_name.description: DNS name that identifies the certificate. If DNS is not present in the SAN extension, this will be the common name.

not_before.description: The start of the validity period for the certificate.

not_after.description: The end of the validity period for the certificate.

CertificateOverviewMetadata.description:
Represents an overview of all the public certificates under a single cert object.
If multiple public certificates on the same CA chain, including the leaf certificate and key are provided, 
this includes `status`, `subject_name`, `not_before` and `not_after` for the leaf certificate.
If a CA bundle is provided, the above mentioned certificate metadata is for the Certificate Authority that
expires the soonest in the bundle.

items.description:
An array of basic metadata for all the SSL certificates in NGINX One Console. 
For a CA bundle, an overview with metadata on the first Certificate Authority in the bundle will be displayed.
Otherwise, an overview with metadata on the leaf certificate will be displayed.

CertificateContent.description: Defines the PEM-formatted certificate content which includes the certificates and corresponding private key, all encoded in base64.

public_certs.description:
Base64-encoded PEM-formatted certificate information. 
The `public_certs` field can include a leaf certificate along with its full chain of trust or a CA bundle. 
For leaf certificates, the accompanying `private_key` is required to authenticate the certificate's validity. 
CA bundles contain trusted CA certificates and may consist of certificates from different CA chains. A private
key should not be included in a CA bundle.

private_key.description:
Base64-encoded private key string for the leaf certificate, required only for certificate-key pairs to 
verify the certificate's authenticity.

CertificateRequest.description: Request structure for parsing or upserting certificates with an optional private key.

name.description: A name for the certificate, making it identifiable among others.

CertificateMetadata.description: A comprehensive list of all the metadata for a public certificate.

version.description: The version of the certificate, typically 3 for X.509 certificates.

serial_number.description: A unique identifier for the certificate.

signature_algorithm.description: Identifies the algorithm used to sign the certificate.

issuer.example: CN=Example CA, O=Certificate Authority Inc., OU=CA Department, L=City, ST=State, C=Country
issuer.description: Identifies the entity who signed and issued the certificate.

not_before.description: The start of the validity period for the certificate.

not_after.description: The end of the validity period for the certificate.

subject.example: CN=www.example.com, O=Example Inc., OU=IT Department, L=City, ST=State, C=Country
subject.description:
Identifies the primary entity to which the certificate is issued. Typically, it contains information
such as the Common Name (CN), Organization (O), Organizational Unit (OU), Country (C), etc.

subject_alternative_name.description:
Defines additional identifies bound to the subject of the certificate. 
For example, the DNS name is used to add additional domain names to a certificate.

public_key_type.description: Identifies the encryption algorithm used to create the public key for the certificate.

common_name.description: The Common Name (CN) for the certificate, used when DNS name is not present in the SAN extension.

authority_key_identifier.description: The identifier of the signing authority for the certificate.

subject_key_identifier.example: 31 EA 76 A9 23 74 A5 DF D4 FD EE A0 C1 A6 9E C6 11 0E 11 EC
subject_key_identifier.description:
A hash value of the SSL certificate that can be used to identify certificates that 
contain a particular public key.

thumbprint_algorithm.description: Defines the algorithm used to hash the certificate.

thumbprint.description: A hash to ensure that the certificate has not been modified.

example.issuer: C=US, ST=WA, L=Seattle, O=F5 Networks, OU=nginx.test, CN=eg3bsriq_cert_bundle_CA
example.subject: C=US, ST=WA, L=Seattle, O=F5 Networks, OU=nginx.test, CN=self_ca_signed

key_size.description: Size of the private key in bits.

encryption_algorithm.description: The encryption algorithm used for the private key.

CertificateResponse.description:
Response structure containing details of the created, updated or retrieved SSL certificate. In general, 
the response should contain:
  * an overview of all the public certificates
  * `warnings` whether any issue is found after parsing the certificates and key
  * `certs`
  * `key_metadata` if key provided in the request body
  * timestamps that represent when this cert object was created or modified

warnings.description: Warnings indicate whether there are any issues with the stored cert object. Empty when no issues were found.

certs.description: An array of metadata for all the public certificates under the cert object.

created_at.description: The date and time when the SSL certificate was created.

modified_at.description: The date and time when the SSL certificate was last modified.

example.name: example-cert_key
example.warnings: The provided private key does not match the certificate's signing key.

certs.issuer: C=US, ST=WA, L=Seattle, O=F5 Networks, OU=nginx.test, CN=eg3bsriq_cert_A
certs.subject: C=US, ST=WA, L=Seattle, O=F5 Networks, OU=nginx.test, CN=eg3bsriq_cert_B

CertificateUpdateContent.description: Defines the PEM-formatted certificate content which includes the certificates and corresponding private key, all encoded in base64.

public_certs.description:
Base64-encoded PEM-formatted certificate information. 
This is used for updating an existing certificate object. The schema is the same as `CertificateContent`,
the only difference is that both `public_certs` and `private_key` fields are optional. There are three use
cases for this schema:
* the below update can be done on either a Cert Key Pair or a CA Bundle:
  * when only `public_certs` is populated, update the public certificates on a certificate object. 
  The updated public certificates will be validated against the existing private key.
* the below update can be done only on a Cert Key Pair:
  * when only `private_key` is populated, update only the private key on a certificate object. 
  The updated private key will be validated against the existing public certificates.
  * when both `public_certs` and `private_key` fields are populated, update both of them on a certificate 
  object.

private_key.description:
Base64-encoded private key string for the leaf certificate, required only for certificate-key pairs to 
verify the certificate's authenticity.

CertificateUpdateRequest.description:
Request structure for updating a certificate object. If key provided, it will be validated against the 
existing leaf certificate stored under the certificate object.
* Update for an unmanaged certificate object:
  * This converts the unmanaged certificate object to managed.
  * `public_certs` should always be provided during the conversion.
  * When key is provided, this certificate object is converted to a managed Cert Key Pair. Otherwise, it is
  converted to a managed CA Bundle.

name.description: A name for the certificate, making it identifiable among others.

CertificateDeploymentStatus.description:

  * `stale` - This certificate deployment is outdated and needs to deploy the latest certificates and key.
  * `unmanaged` - This certificate deployment is unmanaged by NGINX One Console.

CertificateDeployment.description:
Response structure containing certificate deployment details for an SSL certificate, which include
  * `association_type` represents type of the object affected by this certificate deployment, which is either
  an instance or config sync group
  * `object_id` represents the object ID for the associated instance or config sync group
  * `name` for either the host name of an instance or the name of a config sync group
  * `deployment_status`:
    * `latest`: deployment is up to date with the latest updated certificate and key contents
    * `stale`: deployment for either certificates or key is outdated, requires a redeployment with the latest contents
  * `cert_paths` represents the file paths used for deploying public certificates of this certificate object
  * `key_paths` represents the file paths used for deploying the private key of this certificate object, if a
  private key is present

cert_paths.description: Deployment file paths for public certificates.

key_paths.description: Deployment file paths for the private key.

allOf.description: List of certificate deployments for a SSL certificate.

An array of certificate deployments for an SSL certificate. If this certificate object represents a

* `out_of_sync` - Some NGINX instances in config sync group have config different than indicated by config_version.
* `sync_in_progress` - The operation of applying config_version to all NGINX instances in config sync group is in progress.

NginxConfigPayload.description:
Details of Aux File Payload that goes with an NGINX configuration. Provide hints for the backend system on 
additional file contents that should be part of the NGINX Config Publication.
Can be used to deploy files related to SSL certificates, to a data plane instance.

type.description:
Types of Aux File Payload:
  - inline_secret     - indicates the provided content for the payload should be stored in a secret location, and removed after the publication is done.
  - inline_content    - indicates the provided content for the payload should be stored, and removed after the publication is done. Note, the contents may end up in the `aux` content if used in this NGINX configuration.
  - unmanaged_certificate - indicates certificate content for an unmanaged certificate detected from a data plane instance through NGINX configurations. Will be filtered and ignored in the payload deployment.
  - managed_certificate - indicates public certificates managed by NGINX One Console.
  - managed_key - indicates a private key managed by NGINX One Console.
  - nap_policy_version - indicates a version of NAP policy managed by NGINX One Console. A valid policy_version object

contents.description: The base64-encoded contents of the file.

NginxConfigPayloads.description:
An array of payloads that track the file paths of each SSL certificates and key, indicating where to deploy
them onto the data plane instance.
* If the `type` is `managed_certificate` or `managed_key`, you need to specify an `object_id`.
  * The `object_id` must represent a managed certificate object, or a `400 Bad Request` is returned. 
  * The `contents` field is optional and is ignored if included.
* The NGINX One Console manages deployed file paths only for managed certificates and keys. If you don't want 
them to be managed by NGINX One Console, `inline_content` and `inline_secret` can be used for certificates or 
keys, respectively. When you retrieve certificate deployment details, only the file paths of managed 
certificates and keys will be shown.
* If you use `inline_content` and `inline_secret` in your NGINX configuration, the NGINX One Console 
will detect them. When they are used as SSL directives of the NGINX configuration 
for certificates and keys, the certificates will be listed as `unmanaged_certificate` in the certificate 
deployment details.

NginxConfig.description:
Details of an NGINX configuration, including its unique identifier, the main configuration path, the 
configuration directories, and the NGINX configuration payloads that indicate where managed SSL certificates
and keys were deployed to on the data plane instance.

provided, they become the authoritative source of non-NGINX configuration content. Please ensure the
provided contents are complete, missing files that are referenced in the NGINX configuration can cause
NGINX reload failure. When not provided, the previous known auxiliary contents will be used as part of
publish.

* `remote` - The NGINX Agent reported a failure when trying to apply the configuration. See the message for more details.

metrics.description: An array of Metric objects, each including the name of the metric resource, aggregate function, and series details.

MetricQueryMetadata.description: This object includes details about the time period and resolution (granularity) used in the metrics query.

start_time.description: The beginning of the time period for the metrics query (inclusive).

end_time.description: The end point for the time period for the metrics query (non-inclusive).

resolution.description: The level of granularity for the time series data.

MetricEx.description: This object represents a metric, including the name of the metric resource, aggregate function, and series details.

series.description: An array of data points aligned along one or more dimensions from the Dimensions Catalog.

SeriesEx.description: This object represents a set of data points aligned along one or more dimensions from the Dimensions Catalog.

dimensions.description: This object represents a set of data points aligned along one or more dimensions.

additionalProperties.description: The name(s) of the dimensions used in the metrics query.

data.description: Array of data points for a metric.

timestamp.description: A date-time string that represent when the data point in the series was recorded.

value.description: A value for the data, where `null` indicates a gap.

StartTime.description:
Sets the beginning of the time period for your metrics query (inclusive).

Usage:
* `start_time` is required if `end_time` is specified.
* If `start_time` isn't provided, the API returns the latest metrics.
* `start_time` is required for aggregated metrics in order to calculate the `resolution` (granularity).

Time can be specified in two ways:
* Using ISO 8601 format. For example, "2019-08-07T09:57:36.088757764Z".
* As an offset from the current time. For the offset, use `+` or `-`, followed by a number and the appropriate time unit. The time unit can can be `y` (years), `M` (months), `w` (weeks), `d` (days), `h` (hours), `m` (minutes), or `s` (seconds). 
Example of an offset: "now-3h" (3 hours before now).

EndTime.description:
Sets the end point for the time period for your metrics query (non-inclusive).

Usage:
* Must be greater than `start_time`.
* If `start_time` is specified and `end_time` is not, `end_time` defaults to the current time.

Time can be specified in two ways:
* Using ISO 8601 format. For example, "2019-08-07T09:57:36.088757764Z".
* As an offset from the current time. For the offset, use `+` or `-`, followed by a number and the appropriate time unit. The time unit can can be `y` (years), `M` (months), `w` (weeks), `d` (days), `h` (hours), `m` (minutes), or `s` (seconds). 
Example of an offset: "now-3h" (3 hours before now).

MetricAggregation.description:
Static list of aggregation functions that can be applied to a compatible metric.
  * min
  * max
  * sum
  * avg
  * rate

MetricDimensions.description:
List the dimensions to include in the response for each metric series.

Usage:

* Specify the list of dimensions. Dimensions not specified in this parameter will be hidden in the results.
* If you specify dimensions in `group_by`, you don't need to list them again in `dimensions`. 
However, if you are using `group_by`, then any dimensions you list in `dimensions` must also be included in `group_by`.
  * To return a single series, specify the metric name with aggregation (for example, `{ "name": "agent.cpu.system", "aggregate": "avg" }`) and leave the `dimensions` parameter empty.

GroupByDimensions.description:
Group the query results by the specified dimension(s).

Usage:
* Specify the list of dimensions.
* For `group_by` to work, all metrics in the `names` parameter must be aggregated.

TopXMetricDimensions.description: List additional dimensions to include in the response for each metric series. The dimension specified by `group_series_by` will be included by default.

MetricDimension.description:
Static list of all metric dimensions.
  * `display_name` - The display name of the NGINX instance.
  * `file_path` - Path to a desired file.
  * `parent_hostname` - The hostname of the NGINX Plus instance.
  * `instance_object_id` - Instance Object ID is the unique identifier for an Instance registered with NGINX One Console.
  * `location_zone` - The name of an HTTP location zone.
  * `mount_point` - A filesystem mount point.
  * `namespace` - The Namespace associated with the metric data.
  * `network_interface` - A server network interface.
  * `nginx_id` - The unique identifier of an nginx instance running on the data plane.
  * `server_zone` - The name of an HTTP or Stream server zone.
  * `system_id` - The unique identifier of the the operating system where nginx-agent is running.
  * `tenant` - The Tenant associated with the metric data.
  * `csg_object_id` - Config Sync Group Object ID is the unique identifier for a Config Sync Group registered with NGINX One Console.
  * `mode` - Variant value associated with metric `system.cpu.utilization`.
  * `state` - Variant value associated with metrics `system.filesystem.usage`, `system.memory.usage`.
  * `io_direction` - Variant value associated with metric `system.network.io`.
  * `status_range` - Variant value associated with metric `nginx.http.response.count`.

resolution.description:
Specifies the level of granularity for time series data in your results. Applicable only for endpoints that return time series data.

Usage: 
* Specify as a string with a number followed by a unit of time, such as `y` (years), `M` (months), `w` (weeks), `d` (days), `h` (hours), `m` (minutes) or `s` (seconds).
* Metrics in `names` must be aggregated.
* `start_time` is required.
* If `resolution` is not set, the API returns the maximum resolution (`end_time` - `start_time`).

order_by.description:
List the order by for dimension(s).

Usage:

* Must be a dimension included by `dimensions` or `group_by`.

series_limit.description:
Sets the maximum number of series that can be returned.                

Notes:
* Always returns an additional series with a dimension named `all`, aggregating the values of all metrics included in the results.
* A series with a dimension named `other` may be returned, aggregating the values of metrics not included in the results.

MetricNames.description:
Specify the metrics you want details for.

Usage: 
* List multiple metrics as json objects.
  * You can aggregate metrics with `avg`, `sum`, `min`, `max`, `rate`.
* Metrics with aggregates require a `start_time`.
* If you combine aggregated and non-aggregated metrics in a single query, any `group_by` clause applies only to the aggregated metrics.

MetricFilters.description:
Filter results based on dimension operations against one or more values.

Usage:
* Format as one or more predicates by providing all required elements.
  * `dimension`: The dimension name you want to filter on.
  * `operator`: The possible operators (`=`, `!=`, `<`, `<=`, `>`, `>=`, `in`, `not`) you can use for comparison or condition checking.
  * `value`: Case sensitive value of the dimension to filter against.

For more complex filtering:

* Specify a `predicate` for logical expressions (`AND`,`OR`). 
* Use a wildcard `*` in the `value` for matching partial values.

MetricFilterSet.description: Encapsulates one or more `MetricFilter` object(s) to be grouped together.

operator.description:
Static list of all operations supported by filtering

* The `=`, `!=` only use the first element of the `values` array. Wildcards for partial matching is supported.
* The `in` and `not` both use all elements in the `values` array. Wildcards for partial matching is NOT supported.

values.description: Single value used for all operators except `in` and `not`.

OrderBy.description:
Sort order of the metric series in your results.

Usage:
* Provide all required elements.              
  * `direction`: The sorting direction either `desc` or `asc`.
  * `dimension`: The dimension for ordering.

OrderSeriesBy.description:
Sort order of the metric series in your results.

Usage:
* Provide all required elements.              
  * `direction`: The sorting direction either `desc` or `asc`.
  * `aggregate`: The aggregating function.

MetricSystemCpuUtilization.description:
Total system CPU utilization for 'system' or 'user', percentage. A filter differentiator is needed for specific mode(s).

Replacement for depreciated variant(s):
  * system.cpu.system
  * system.cpu.user

Aggregation(s) supported:
  * min
  * max
  * sum
  * avg
  * rate

Catalog dimension filter differentiator:
  * mode (applicable filter values: 'system', 'user')

Catalog dimension(s) supported:
  * instance_object_id
  * csg_object_id
  * system_id
  * parent_hostname
  * display_name
  * nginx_id

MetricSystemFilesystemUsage.description:
System disk usage statistic, percentage. A filter differentiator is needed for specific state(s).

Replacement for depreciated variant(s):
  * system.disk.in_use
  * system.disk.total
  * system.disk.used

Aggregation(s) supported:
  * min
  * max
  * sum
  * avg
  * rate

Catalog dimension filter differentiator:
  * state (applicable filter values: 'used', 'free', 'in_use')

Catalog dimension(s) supported:
  * instance_object_id
  * csg_object_id
  * system_id
  * parent_hostname
  * display_name
  * nginx_id
  * mount_point

MetricSystemMemoryUsage.description:
Total available statistic about system memory usage, bytes. A filter differentiator is needed for specific state(s).

Replacement for depreciated variant(s):

  * system.mem.used

Aggregation(s) supported:

  * max
  * sum
  * avg
  * rate      

Catalog dimension filter differentiator:
  * state (applicable filter values: 'used', 'free', 'total', 'pct_used')

Catalog dimension(s) supported:

  * csg_object_id
  * system_id
  * parent_hostname
  * display_name
  * nginx_id

Number of logical (virtual) processor cores created by the operating system.

Aggregation(s) supported:

  * avg

MetricSystemNetworkIo.description:
Network I/O statistics. Number of bytes sent or received per network interface. A filter differentiator is needed for specific I/O direction(s).

Replacement for depreciated variant(s):
  * system.net.bytes_rcvd
  * system.net.bytes_sent

Aggregation(s) supported:
  * min
  * max
  * sum
  * avg
  * rate

Catalog dimension filter differentiator:
  * io_direction (applicable filter values: 'transmit', 'receive')

Catalog dimension(s) supported:
  * instance_object_id
  * csg_object_id
  * system_id
  * parent_hostname
  * display_name
  * nginx_id
  * network_interface

MetricNginxHttpRequestCount.description:
The current number of client requests received from clients.

Replacement for depreciated variant(s):
  * nginx.http.request.count
  * plus.http.request.count

Aggregation(s) supported:
  * min
  * max
  * sum
  * avg
  * rate

Catalog dimension(s) supported:

  * csg_object_id
  * system_id
  * parent_hostname
  * display_name
  * nginx_id
  * server_zone
  * location_zone

MetricNginxHttpResponseCount.description:
The current number of responses, grouped by status code range. A filter differentiator is needed for specific status range(s).

Replacement for depreciated variant(s):
  * nginx.http.status.4xx
  * plus.http.status.4xx

Aggregation(s) supported:
  * min
  * max
  * sum
  * avg
  * rate

Catalog dimension filter differentiator:
  * status_range (applicable filter values: '4xx', '5xx')

Catalog dimension(s) supported:
  * instance_object_id
  * csg_object_id
  * system_id
  * parent_hostname
  * display_name
  * nginx_id          
  * server_zone
  * location_zone

MetricStartTime.description:
The start time of your metrics query.

Usage:
* `start_time` is required if `end_time` is specified.
* If `start_time` and `end_time` isn't provided, the API returns metrics from the current time to the month before the current time.
* The `start_time` cannot be older than 120 days before the current time.

You can set the `start_time` in these ways:
* In ISO 8601 format. For example, "2019-08-07T09:57:36.088757764Z".
* As an offset from the current time. For the offset, use `+` or `-`, followed by a number and unit [`y` (years), `M` (months), `w` (weeks), `d` (days), `h` (hours), `m` (minutes), or `s` (seconds)]. 
* Example of an offset: "now-3h" (3 hours before now).

MetricEndTime.description:
The end time of your metrics query.

Usage:
* Must be greater than `start_time`.
* The time difference between `start_time` and `end_time` should be greater than an hour.
* The default `end_time` is the current time.
* The `end_time` cannot be older than 120 days before the current time.

You can set the `end_time` in these ways:
* In ISO 8601 format. For example, "2019-08-07T09:57:36.088757764Z".
* As an offset from the current time. For the offset, use `+` or `-`, followed by a number and unit [`y` (years), `M` (months), `w` (weeks), `d` (days), `h` (hours), `m` (minutes), or `s` (seconds)]. 
* Example of an offset: "now-3h" (3 hours before now).

FilterNameNapPolicy.description:
Keywords for NGINX App Protect policy filters.
When filtering on `enforcement_mode`, only the following `filter_values` are supported:
  * blocking
  * transparent
When filtering on `object_id`, both NAP Policy and NAP Policy version object id prefixes are supported.

FilterNameNapPolicyDeployment.description:
Keywords for NGINX App Protect deployment filters.
When filtering on `type`, only the following `filter_values` are supported:
  * instance
  * config_sync_group
When filtering on `status`, only the following `filter_values` are supported:
  * deployed
  * deploying
  * failed

FilterNameNapPolicyVersion.description:
Keywords for NGINX App Protect policy version filters.
When filtering on `deployment_status`, only the following `filter_values` are supported:
  * deployed
  * not_deployed
  * deploying
  * failed
When filtering on `enforcement_mode`, only the following `filter_values` are supported:
  * blocking
  * transparent
